Title: Advertising & Network Infrastructure Maintenance
Description:
Centro is seeking suitable suppliers for its Advertising and Network Infrastructure Maintenance contracts that are due to commence on 1st July 2016 for a period of 10 years. This is to replace Centro's existing contracts that expire on 30th June 2016.
The contracts consist of the following Lots:
- Lot 1 Roadside Asset Advertising
- Lot 2 Commercialisation of Assets
- Lot 3 Infrastructure Cleaning & Audit
- Lot 4 Highway Infrastructure Maintenance
- Lot 5 Highway Infrastructure Supply, Install
- Lot 6 Grounds Maintenance
- Lot 7 Timetable cases.
Bidders can submit tenders for any or all of the Lot(s) above. Tenders are due back by the closing date of 1000 on Thursday 24th March 2016 and the deadline for clarification questions is 12 noon on Monday 7th March 2016. Centro is holding pre-tender Briefing Sessions for all interested bidders commencing at 1400 on Tuesday 23rd February 2016 and 1030 on Wednesday 24th February 2016 at Centro House, Birmingham. If either of these are of interest would you please confirm your attendance by 1700 on Monday 22nd February 2016.
It is Centro's intention to make the contracts available to other local authorities in the UK.
This will consist of the following:
- all county councils, borough and district councils and unitary authorities throughout England, Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales (please see: - www.direct.gov.uk/en/DI1/Directories/Localcouncils/AToZOfLocalCouncils/index.htm)
- West Midlands Integrated Transport Authority
- West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive
- Merseyside Integrated Transport Authority
- West Yorkshire Integrated Transport Authority
- West Yorkshire Passenger Transport Executive
- South Yorkshire Integrated Transport Authority
- South Yorkshire Passenger Transport Executive
- Tyne & Wear Integrated Transport Authority
- Tyne & Wear Passenger Transport Executive
- Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
- Transport for Greater Manchester
- Transport for London
- Strathclyde Partnership for Transport.
Each of these organisations will contract directly with the successful suppliers. There is, however, no obligation on any other Contracting Authorities to utilise any of these contracts.   
Please note that all communications in relation to these contracts will be through BravoSolution, Centro's e-tendering portal (please see https://centro.bravosolution.co.uk and the attached document outlining how to register for more details), which is also the location to download all tender documents and upload bidder responses, no other means of communication will be accepted. 
If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact the eTendering help desk.
Please note that the reference for the Qualification document in BravoSolution is: itt_295.
The tender reference for each Lot in BravoSolution is as follows:
Lot 1 - itt_304
Lot 2 - itt_305
Lot 3 - itt_296
Lot 4 - itt_297
Lot 5 - itt_301
Lot 6 - itt_302
Lot 7 - itt_303.

Title: Commercial Partner to manage Large Format Digital Advertising Screens
Description:
Liverpool City Council (the Contracting Authority) is seeking a commercial partner or partners to manage large format digital advertising signs, by way of concession, using a bespoke Competitive Procedure with Negotiation.                                                       
The successful commercial partner will be responsible for the installation and maintenance of the large digital format advertising boards across the City, and will be able to exploit the opportunities for selling of advertising on these formats.
The Contracting Authority requires a Guaranteed annual revenue and % share of Gross Sales over the 10 year concession period.
The Contracting Authority also invites Bidders to identify and optimise other potential sites across the City of Liverpool for approval, by bringing sites forward for development as part of the concession.
Further details are set out in the tender documents.

Title: PAN1153 - Supply, Installation and Maintenance of Bus Shelters and Information Panels
Description:
Leicester City Council invites Tenders for the supply, installation, maintenance and cleaning of bus shelters and information panels. This will be a concession contract under which the successful Supplier generates income to fund these services from selling advertising space on the panels/shelters.
The proposed Contract will be for ten years with an option to extend for a period or periods totalling no more than a further five years.

Title: Digital Advertising Screens and Marketing
Description:
Torbay Council requires a suitably experienced Contractor to work with the Authority, to help raise revenue through the sale of advertising on outdoor digital screen assets. The Contractor will provide and install the screens and seek out, agree and manage commercial advertising packages for the Asset Portfolio contained within the attached Appendix C Initial Locations for advertising. 
The Council has identified eight urban locations for outdoor digital advertising display screens of up to 48 sheet in size.
Additional Text:
In order to provide unrestricted, full, direct and free of charge access to the Tender Documents the Authority is providing the Documents in PDF format in the Opportunities Area of the ProContract e-Tendering portal at www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk
In order to access amendable versions of the Documents and to submit a response Applicants must be registered as Suppliers on ProContract. Applicants should then express an interest in the opportunity and download the Word and Excel format Documents for completion and submission.

Title: Advertising Concession for Bus Shelters and Free-Standing Advertising Units
Description:
Milton Keynes Council has awarded a concession contract to a suitably experienced and competent supplier, for the provision of advertising services. The concession contract comprises;
- The supply of advertising units, whether affixed to Bus Shelters or as free-standing units, at existing designated sites throughout the borough of Milton Keynes.
- On-going maintenance of the advertising units.
- The development of a marketing and sales strategy to maximise the revenue generation potential for commercial advertising media to be displayed in the advertising units, including identifying potential additional advertising sites.
A portion of the revenue generation generated will be paid to the Council as detailed in the tender documents.

Title: Out of Home Advertising Large and Small Format
Description: The council is offering the opportunity to manage large and small format advertising concessions in the city of Southampton. We are looking for a service provider(s) who can enhance the cityscape through the provision of high-quality, high specification digital display advertising in the city and districts centres and on the key road network. Opportunities for large format advertising exists in the city centre and key routes in and out of the city which carry in excess of 110,000 commuters per day. Opportunities for small format (six sheet) advertising exists in the city centre and district centres.

Title: Invitation to Tender for Bus Shelter Advertising Supply/Erection and Maintenance (Option A) and Advertising Only (Option B).
Description: Ipswich is the county town of Suffolk with a population of around 137,500 within the Borough, expanding to around 350,000 within a 15 mile radius. A thriving urban area, Ipswich is well provisioned with shops, parks, leisure and cultural facilities that help to make it a regional centre within East Anglia. Sitting at the point where the A14 and A12 meet and the Great Eastern Mainline connects with other regional railway lines, Ipswich is well connected to the wider world and is also a leading area of public and private employment with particular emphasis on the insurance/finance, IT/creative and logistics sectors. The primary purpose of this tender is for the provision of a number of high quality bus shelters for the bus passengers of Ipswich, financed through the exclusive provision of advertising upon the said shelters. Two options are proposed as the methods of delivery and bidders are required to submit bids for both. Option A sees the bidder supply, install and maintain the advertising style bus shelters. Bidders are required to state the number of such shelters that they would supply and the amount they would pay to the Council per such shelter per year. This would be increased throughout the agreement in line with the Retail Prices Index. Under this option, the Council has a sub-option during the agreement for the successful bidder to clean and/or maintain Council owned bus shelters as well (which do not carry advertising) for which bidders must indicate a cost to the Council per shelter per year. This would also be increased throughout the agreement in line with the Retail Prices Index. In both cases, financial penalties would apply for poor performance. Under this option, bidders are required to submit as many designs (including detailed technical drawings) for advertising style bus shelters as they wish, provided that at least one design is submitted for shelters in conservation areas and outside listed buildings (a ‘special’ design) and one for other locations (a ‘standard’ design). A single design can be submitted for both categories if desired. All designs must meet the Council’s Specification. Option B sees the Council supply, install and maintain the advertising style bus shelters (with financial penalties for poor performance). The bidder is required to sell the advertising spaces and arrange for the advertising to be provided and changed as required. Bidders would pay a fixed amount to the Council per shelter per year. This would be increased throughout the agreement in line with the Retail Prices Index. Bidders are required to state the amount that they are prepared to pay to the Council per shelter per year and the number of advertising style bus shelters that they are prepared to pay this amount for. For both Option A and Option B, bidders are required to submit bids for a 10 year and a 15 year agreement, during which time the bidder would have exclusive advertising rights on all the bus shelters provided under the agreement,
